Blog.post: urlLink Goofy photo of me on the trail last night. urlLink
urlLink "Can I pleeeeeaaase have another milk bone!!!!!!!" urlLink
urlLink After the ride Mary cooked up a great dish for me with pasta, asparagus and scallops. Ileya was really bummed she couldn't have any. urlLink
urlLink Rode the new trail in Tuskegee last night, sure is a lot harder to hold a camera steady on the Mountain Bike than the road bike! urlLink
urlLink This is Mary, giving Ileya a bath, I love my Holga! urlLink
urlLink I recently scanned this photo of Mary in the subway station in DC, it was taken during our trip there a couple months ago. urlLink
urlLink The trailhead at the Tuskegee Trail. urlLink
urlLink Riding down Pike Road on July 24th. urlLink
Had a great weekend, got both bikes out. Rode the Pike road area on Saturday, and the new trail in Tuskegee Sunday. I'm trying to post photos.
Well here's my first attempt at a web blog. Suppose I'll get it going soon.
urlLink Another photo from the same place, had my new blinky lights going on the bar ends. I hope the blog isn't getting too repetitive! urlLink
urlLink Another lap by the same spot, riding into the sunset. The weather is starting to cool a bit, and it was a beautiful way to end my day! urlLink

urlLink Went for a ride in Auburn last night. I found a short little loop around the Keisel park area, was a great place to ride as there were a couple small hills and I didn't have to worry about getting too far away in the dark. urlLink
Not much to say this morning, but htought I'd post a link to Thinh's blog: urlLink http://nugeworthy.blogspot.com/

urlLink Only two photos to post from this weekend. Went for a short ride in Pintlala yesterday and Mary stopped to rescue a turtle that walking over a bridge, she has a thing for turtles. He surely would have been splattered by this big ol tractor that came by as she was saving it. She carried down the woods under the bridge and sat him free next to a mud puddle. urlLink
urlLink Close up of the turtle. urlLink
urlLink This is what my balcony looks like this year. Swapped the old metal chairs out for some wood benches, added a couple lattices and a fish pond. urlLink
urlLink Not a whole lot to post this week, did go for a nice ride in the country on Sunday. The heat eased up a little bit this weekend, and the views were awesome urlLink
urlLink Not much went on this past weekend, but did go for a ride around Auburn. Here's Mary reaching to shift on a hill. urlLink
